text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Capital Region of Denmark | native_name = Region Hovedstaden | native_name_lang = da | settlement_type = Region of Denmark | image_flag = Flag of the Capital Region of Denmark.svg | flag_size = 100px | image_blank_emblem = Danish Region hovedstaden logo.svg | blank_emblem_size = 100px | blank_emblem_type = | image_map = Hovedstaden in Denmark.svg | mapsize = 250px | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Denmark | subdivision_type1 = Largest city | subdivision_name1 = Copenhagen | seat_type = Capital | seat = Hillerød | leader_title = Chairman | leader_name = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 2,568.29 | population_footnotes = FOLK1: Population quarterly database from Statistics Denmark | population_total = 1,848,989 | population_as_of = 1 October 2019 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +1 | timezone1_DST = CEST | utc_offset1_DST = +2 | website = www.regionh.dk | footnotes = }} The Capital Region of Denmark is an administrative region of Denmark. The capital city is Hillerød. Denmark's largest lake, Arresø, is in the region. It is also home to the deepest lake, Furesø. ==Municipalities of Region Hovedstaden== There are 29 municipalities in the Capital Region of Denmark. * Copenhagen * Frederiksberg * Albertslund * Allerød * Ballerup * Bornholm * Brøndby * Dragør * Egedal * Fredensborg * Frederikssund * Furesø * Gentofte * Gladsaxe * Glostrup * Gribskov * Halsnæs * Herlev * Hillerød * Hørsholm * Høje-Taastrup * Hvidovre * Ishøj * Lyngby-Taarbæk * Rudersdal * Rødovre * Tårnby * Vallensbæk ==References== Category:2007 establishments in Denmark
title: Capital Region of Denmark
